text:
Declaring an independent in-tree package via AC_CONFIG_SUBDIRS arranges things
such that (with autoconf 2.5x) ./configure --help=recursive displays configure
options for all such packages.  

In Apache, we use APR_SUBDIR_CONFIG, which does not support recursive help.  It
should; this might avoid bugs such as #17244.  If I get around to it, I will
work on this.
creator: noah@cs.caltech.edu
maxb@apache.org
text:
autoconf makes this very hard to fix - impossible, without prying into its
internals to some extent. Is the pain of doing this worth the gain?

creator: maxb@apache.org
text:
It is my belief that this bug is not fixable without unmaintainable prying into
autoconf's internals.

The proper way to fix this would likely be to enhance autoconf's existing subdir
support so that it became capable of invoking subconfigures during, rather than
after, main configuration - the lack of this possibility being why
APR_SUBDIR_CONFIG exists at all.

I am closing this bug as WONTFIX. If anyone disagrees with my summation of the
situation, then please feel free to reopen the bug.
